revised_title: Reevaluating the Generic Identity of Sceparnodon and Phascolonus
tldr: The author examines the fossils of Sceparnodon and Phascolonus, two extinct wombats from the Pleistocene of Australia, and concludes that they are actually the same species. The confusion arose from the fact that Sceparnodon was based on upper incisors, while Phascolonus was based on lower jaws. The author provides evidence from a collection of fossils from Miall Creek, Australia, which supports the idea that these two genera are one and the same.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Paleontology
